Column Comment.0: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.1: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, acquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.2: ACQTN DATE: Date on which the agreement was acquired and brought in house
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.6: LAND RIGHT CALCULATED INTEREST: Derived from LR BA Partner Interest. Thisis your net value, as determined from the fractional interest held through the chain oftitle. Also called derived gross interest. Denormalized through recursive query fromBA_INT_SET_PARTNER. This derived value may be stored here rather thanrequiring a complex query to be run that determines the fractional interest on the fly.If used, ensure that it will be automatically updated when the source information inLR INT SET PARTNER is updated.
Column Comment.7: CASE SERIAL NUMBER: CASE is a US Bureau of Land Management elementwhich provides a coded number system to identify any type of CASE, such as salesof land, mineral and timber land disposal by occupancy, grant of sale, surfaceauthorization f or right of way, land use, etc.
Column Comment.8: CONFIDENTIAL INDICATOR: Indicates the agreement is confidential; ownership ofthe agreement is not public knowledge.
Column Comment.9: COST CENTER NUMBER: A code linking the land right to a cost center system. Maybe an AFE number, property code, or whatever is used to connect to the source offunding.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: FIRST PLATFORM APPROVED DATE: Date on which the first platform wasapproved for a lease. Reported by jurisdiction.
Column Comment.13: FIRST PLATFORM INSTALLED DATE: Date on which the first platform was installedfor a lease. Reported by jurisdiction.
Column Comment.14: FIRST PRODUCTION DATE: Date on which the qualifying well was placed oncontinuous production. Reported by jurisdiction.
Column Comment.15: LAND RIGHT FRACTIONAL INTEREST: Denormalized through recursive query fromBA_INT_SET_PARTNER. This is your net value or derived gross interest. May be1/3 of 1/2 of 1/2 etc. This derived value may be stored here rather than requiring acomplex query to be run that determines the fractional interest on the fly. If used,ensure that it will be automatically updated when the source information in LR INTSET PARTNER is updated.
Column Comment.16: GRANTED RIGHT TYPE: The type of right granted to the holder. May include title,lease, P and NG lease, license, Permit P and NG, SDL, SDA, Exploration license,production license, drilling license, JOA, Pooling agreement etc. Called Documenttype by some systems.
Column Comment.17: GROSS SIZE: Total amount of land measured in hectares/acres in the land right
Column Comment.18: GROSS SIZE OUOM: Usually hectares or acres
Column Comment.19: HIGH WATER DEPTH: Highest mean sea level to the sea floor
Column Comment.21: INACTIVATION DATE: Date on which the land right was inactivated due to expiry,surrender, sale etc.
Column Comment.22: INCENTIVE CERTIFICATE NUMBER: Number on the incentive certificate.
Column Comment.23: ISSUE DATE: Date on which the land right was issued.
Column Comment.24: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.25: LAND ACQUISITION MEHOD: the method used to acquire the rights to this landright. May be purchase, lease, license, partnership, farmin, farmout, rental etc.
Column Comment.26: R LAND CASE ACTION: last action made to the case file.
Column Comment.27: R LAND CASE TYPE: timber, geothermal....
Column Comment.28: R LAND PROPERTY TYPE: the property designation for reporting acreages, such ascore, non core, core developed, core non developed etc.
Column Comment.29: LAND RIGHT CATEGORY: The category of land right. May be Mineral or Surface orboth Mineral and surface.
Column Comment.30: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale
Column Comment.31: LAND SALE OFFERING ID: Unique identifier for the land sale offering.
Column Comment.32: LAST ACTION DATE: Date actions affected a change or a notation to a CASE file.
Column Comment.33: LESSOR NAME: Un-validated name of lessor company
Column Comment.34: LESSOR NUMBER: The reference number assigned by the lessor by which theagreement is known.
Column Comment.35: R LAND LESSOR TYPE: the type of lessor, such as federal, Indian, public, BIA,Aboriginal
Column Comment.36: LOW WATER DEPTH: Lowest mean sea level to the sea floor
Column Comment.38: R MUNICIPALITY: name of the municipality
Column Comment.39: OCCUPANT NAME: The unvalidated name of the occupant on this land right.
Column Comment.40: OFFSHORE DISTANCE: The approximate distance from the lease to the nearestcoastline.
Column Comment.41: OFFSHORE DISTANCE OUOM: original units of The approximate distance from thelease to the nearest coastline.
Column Comment.42: OIL SANDS DEPOSIT: Code identifying the natural reservoir of oil sands.
Column Comment.43: OVERLAP IND: Indicates if the agreements creates overlap acreage with anotheragreement. Details in LR XREF
Column Comment.44: PLATFORM COUNT: Number of platforms on the lease
Column Comment.45: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.46: PRIMARY TERM DURATION: Length of primary term for the agreement
Column Comment.47: PRIMARY TERM DURATION OUOM: original units of whether the term of theagreement is years or months
Column Comment.48: PRODUCING IND: Whether the MA is producing. Derived from the Well status. Put infor performance only. Y = producing
Column Comment.49: PROPRIETARY NUM: Number by which the agreement is known by the owner of thedatabase. Other reference numbers are stored in LR ALIAS
Column Comment.50: QUALIFICATION DATE: Date when the lease is deemed capable of producing inpaying quantities. When this condition has been met, the lease qualifies forcontinuation beyond the primary term. Can be called a declaration date.
Column Comment.51: RECLAMATION CERTIFICATE NUMBR: reference number for the certificate ofenvironmental reclamation completed for the land right. Assigned by a regulatory orjurisdictional agency.
Column Comment.52: RECLAMATION END DATE: the date that reclamation on this land right wascomplete. If there are subordinate land rights, this is generally tracked only at onelevel; use the LR XREF table to ensure that every part of the surface is properlyreclaimed.
Column Comment.53: RECLAMATION START DATE: the date that reclamation on this land right began. Ifthere are subordinate land rights, this is generally tracked only at one level; use theLR XREF table to ensure that every part of the surface is properly reclaimed.
Column Comment.54: RELINQUISHABLE INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating whether the land right canbe relinquished back to the lessor. In some areas, the lessor may not permit thelessee to relinquish a land right before the end of the primary term.
Column Comment.55: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.56: RENTAL ALLOCATION INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that rentals areallocated and paid at this level. Usually for a land lease or a land granted right.
Column Comment.57: REPORT ACREAGE INDICATOR: Indicates whether acreage reports should becreated using this land right.
Column Comment.58: SCHEME APPROVAL NUMBER: Number assigned to a scheme application afterbeing approved.
Column Comment.59: SCHEME EXPIRY DATE: Date a particular scheme approval expires.
Column Comment.60: SECONDARY TERM DURATION: the length of time that the secondary term will bevalid for, as defined in the agreement. Not all land rights have secondary terms.
Column Comment.62: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.63: SUB SURFACE RIGHTS INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this land rightincludes subsurface (mineral) rights.
Column Comment.64: SURFACE RIGHTS INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that this land right includessurface rights.
Column Comment.65: TERMINATION NOTICE PERIOD: Length of notice required for termination of lease
Column Comment.66: TERMINATION NOTICE PERIOD OUOM: original units of usually days, months oryears.
Column Comment.67: TERM EXPIRY DATE: the date that the current term for this land right will expire, tobe used for planning purposes. Can be derived from the EFFECTIVE DATE and thePRIMARY TERM.
Column Comment.68: UNIT OPERATED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that this land right is ownedand operated by a unit.
Column Comment.69: R WELL QUALIFICATION TYPE: defines the type of method used to determine thatthe well is capable of producing in paying quantities.
Column Comment.70: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.71: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.72: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.73: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.74: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.75: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.76: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
